name: blueberry cheesecake bars
directions: preheat oven to 325â„‰. line and grease a 9x13 pan.
mix graham crumbs and melted butter; press into the bottom of the pan.
bake crust for 10 minutes until slightly darkened.
whisk cream cheese, sugar, and flour on low speed until smooth.
add sour cream, vanilla, and zest; mix until combined.
add eggs one at a time, mixing gently after each addition.
blend blueberries until smooth and drop spoonfuls over the batter. swirl with a knife.
bake for 30-35 minutes until the middle is almost set.
turn off the oven but leave the cheesecake inside with the door closed for 20 minutes.
open the oven door slightly and let it sit for another 30 minutes.
refrigerate for at least 2 hours before cutting to prevent cracking.
notes: the slow cooling process is essential for a smooth surface.
